report.title: Samples List for earthwormwatch_sample_occurrences form
report.description: Used by the Samples grid to retrieve the pit samples associated with a user. User can be identified by their Indicia User ID. A second sample may be linked to a first sample, the id of which is stored in a custom attribute. The id of that custom attribute is passed as a parameter to the report.
report.query: WITH samples1 AS ( SELECT s.id as sample_id1, COALESCE(s.location_name, s.entered_sref) as location_name, s.date_start, s.date_end, s.date_type FROM samples s LEFT JOIN sample_attribute_values sav ON sav.sample_id = s.id AND sav.sample_attribute_id = #s1AttrID# #joins# WHERE s.survey_id = #survey_id# AND s.deleted = FALSE AND s.created_by_id = #iUserID# AND (s.date_start >= CAST(COALESCE('#ignore_dates_before#','1500-01-01') as date) OR '#ignore_dates_before#'='') AND (sav.int_value = 0 OR sav.int_value IS null) ), samples2 AS ( SELECT s.id AS sample_id2, sav.int_value AS sample_id1, s.date_start, s.date_end, s.date_type FROM samples s JOIN sample_attribute_values sav ON sav.sample_id = s.id AND sav.sample_attribute_id = #s1AttrID# AND (sav.int_value != 0 AND sav.int_value IS NOT null) WHERE s.survey_id = #survey_id# AND s.deleted = FALSE AND s.created_by_id = #iUserID# ) SELECT s1.*, s2.sample_id2, to_char(s2.date_start,'DD/MM/YYYY') as survey_2_date, CASE WHEN sample_id2 IS null THEN true ELSE false END AS done1, CASE WHEN sample_id2 IS null THEN false ELSE true END AS done2 FROM samples1 s1 LEFT JOIN samples2 s2 ON s2.sample_id1 = s1.sample_id1 #order_by#

param.name: survey_id
param.description: Select the survey to return data for?
param.query: SELECT id, title as caption FROM surveys

param.name: iUserID
param.description: Indicia User ID: use 0 to ignore

param.name: s1AttrID
param.description: The ID of the sample attribute that links a second sample to a first

param.name: ignore_dates_before
param.description: Ignore pit samples whose date is before this date (we can ignore previous years data).
